channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16520] TableBackupProcedure ctor should set procedure owner
item.description:
I was trying to abort a procedure which led to master shutdown.
Toward tail of the master log, I saw:


2016-08-29 20:25:26,180 ERROR [B.fifo.QRpcServer.handler=16,queue=1,port=20000] coprocessor.CoprocessorHost: The coprocessor org.apache.ranger.authorization.hbase.RangerAuthorizationCoprocessor threw    java.lang.NullPointerException

java.lang.NullPointerException

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.procedure2.ProcedureExecutor.isProcedureOwner(ProcedureExecutor.java:653)

        at org.apache.ranger.authorization.hbase.RangerAuthorizationCoprocessor.preAbortProcedure(RangerAuthorizationCoprocessor.java:835)

        at org.apache.ranger.authorization.hbase.RangerAuthorizationCoprocessor.preAbortProcedure(RangerAuthorizationCoprocessor.java:3107)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.MasterCoprocessorHost$47.call(MasterCoprocessorHost.java:601)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.MasterCoprocessorHost.execOperation(MasterCoprocessorHost.java:1146)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.MasterCoprocessorHost.preAbortProcedure(MasterCoprocessorHost.java:597)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.HMaster.abortProcedure(HMaster.java:2654)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.MasterRpcServices.abortProcedure(MasterRpcServices.java:1070)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.protobuf.generated.MasterProtos$MasterService$2.callBlockingMethod(MasterProtos.java:57274)

        at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.RpcServer.call(RpcServer.java:2127)

Under /procedures.jsp (after restart), the procedure I tried to abort had null as Owner.
item.summary: TableBackupProcedure ctor should set procedure owner

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
This was on a cluster based on 1.1.2 with procedure enhancements backported.

Here was the procedure to be aborted:

FullTableBackupProcedure (targetRootDir=hdfs://test-3.openstacklocal:8020//user/hbase/hbase-staging/backupIT; backupId=backup_1472494448801; tables=IntegrationTestBackupRestore.table1,IntegrationTestBackupRestore.table2)

which version are you using? ProcedureExecutor.java:653 does not match any version on github
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.procedure2.ProcedureExecutor.isProcedureOwner(ProcedureExecutor.java:653)

anyway, did your procedure set the user name?

Thanks for the hint, Matteo.

Here is initial attempt at fixing the bug.
Patch v2 covers incremental backup procedure.

The patch does not completely fix the issue - once master failover, you will lose the user information. You need to store the info in MasterProcedure.proto and add it during serializeStateData and deserializeStateData inside the procedure.
if you don't use user.doAs() you don't need to serialize the user. you can just rely on the proc serialization for the owner.

user.doAs() is not done at this stage.

Once we figure out the full semantics for backup / restore ACL, we can handle it.

+1 overall

If this.user is unused in procedure, then you don't need the member variable, just "this.setOwner(env.getRequestUser().getUGI().getShortUserName());" in the constructor.

If this.user is used in procedure (eg. user.doAs() in the coprocessor steps), then you need to add it to MasterProcedure.proto and serializeStateData and deserializeStateData
Patch v3 addresses Stephen's comment.

-1 overall

V3 looks good to me.
Thanks for the reviews, Stephen and Matteo.

Matteo Bertozzi:
ProcedureExecutor#isProcedureOwner() assumes every procedure has an owner.

Should we protect against NPE by checking the return value of proc.getOwner() before dereferencing ?

having an owner at least from non-testing procedure is a "must" for debuggability. every procedure should set it.

what is your suggestion to avoid the NPE? just returning false if there is no user or throwing another exception like "the procedure has no owner"? not sure which one I like more. at the end aside from testing where we can skip the owner we will like to always have it.. so having an assert or an exception here does not make much difference in term of result.

isProcedureOwner() doesn't declare to throw IOE.

It would be a surprise when aborting non-owned procedure brings down master.

I think returning false if there is no owner would be fine. Open to alternatives.

Another approach is to call proc.getOwner() when proc is loaded first time.

If there is no owner, fail the loading.

Tentative change:

http://pastebin.com/wzugwxta

I'd like this idea of forcing the owner. It should be on ProcedureExecutor#submitProcedure() and not on load() so every proc will pass from there as first operation.
the only problem with that is that now you also force tests to set an owner... maybe we can have a flag like "check owner set" that we set to true by default but in the test/resources/hbase-site.xml we set it to false. so the test will not fail
If "check owner set" is turned off for tests, how would we find the stock procedures which lack ownership ?

by trying to start the cluster and execute the command. or by enabling it for the specific procedure test.
or you can use the rule, stuff under hbase-procedure can work without owner. hbase-server must have owner.

Is there API for obtaining hbase module given class ?

What if new procedure is added to other module(s) ?

IMHO if a no-owner procedure is loaded and then aborted, the resulting master crash is something we should avoid.

Currently I am considering this change:


diff --git a/hbase-procedure/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/procedure2/ProcedureExecutor.java b/hbase-procedure/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/procedure2/ProcedureExecutor.java

index f714260..12353b4 100644

--- a/hbase-procedure/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/procedure2/ProcedureExecutor.java

+++ b/hbase-procedure/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/procedure2/ProcedureExecutor.java

@@ -650,6 +650,7 @@ public class ProcedureExecutor<TEnvironment> {

     Preconditions.checkArgument(isRunning());

     Preconditions.checkArgument(lastProcId.get() >= 0);

     Preconditions.checkArgument(!proc.hasParent());

+    Preconditions.checkArgument(proc.getOwner() != null);



     // Initialize the Procedure ID

     long currentProcId = nextProcId();

I plan to log another JIRA since there're test procedures which owner should be set.

Mind continuing comment over HBASE-16532 ?

Thanks
